body_html: I realized that if I let the cifar10_train.py and cifar10_eval.py files keep running simultaneously, despite the queue errors, the precision @ 1 is reported every 5 minutes. One can reduce this time interval by decreasing the value of 'eval_interval_secs' in the cifar10_eval.py file to see more frequent updates.
body_text: I realized that if I let the cifar10_train.py and cifar10_eval.py files keep running simultaneously, despite the queue errors, the precision @ 1 is reported every 5 minutes. One can reduce this time interval by decreasing the value of 'eval_interval_secs' in the cifar10_eval.py file to see more frequent updates.
body: I realized that if I let the `cifar10_train.py` and `cifar10_eval.py` files keep running simultaneously, despite the `queue` errors, the `precision @ 1` is reported every 5 minutes. One can reduce this time interval by decreasing the value of `'eval_interval_secs'` in the `cifar10_eval.py` file to see more frequent updates.
